author: Gregory Betts
text:
The Human Relations Commission of the City of Palo Alto (population 65,000 San Francisco Bay Area) is doing a study on how communities address the housing needs of low income residents, especially in built out communities with high land values. 

What policies does your community have in place to protect, develop, or enhance low-income housing?
How does your community balance an economic mix of residents and keep higher-income developments from driving out low-income residents?
Does your community negotiate arrangements with sellers and developers to reduce the negative impacts of developments that may displace low-income residents?

Please send your responses to Minka.VanDerZwaag@cityofpaloalto.org    Thanks so much.
title: Preserving Housing for Low Income Residents
